This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, leadership & community service initiatives, and other student
opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age requirements,
and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Please note that in order to save space, many sections contain links to general lists
of related opportunities- such as for Stem programs, Community Service, College
Prep free programs, and more - be sure to click on any links that interest you.
Here are a few examples of the excellent opportunities & programs to be found in the
sections below – many deadlines are fast-approaching, so interested students should
explore these options and apply ASAP!
ACADEMICS: The six-week summer CCNY STEM Institute offers a variety of
courses to current 9th, 10th, and 11th graders – the application deadline is May 25th!
The Queensborough Community College’s summer Robotics Program is open to
current sophomores and juniors, interested students should apply ASAP.
In addition to the summer term free CUNY College Now college-level courses, many
CUNY campuses have opened applications for their fall term College Now classes in
both STEM and Humanities fields. There are varying eligibility requirements, check
this section to learn more.
GOVERNMENT/LEADERSHIP/HISTORY: The Sadie Nash Summer Leadership
program welcomes applications from any students who identify as female or gender-
expansive. It runs for six weeks, and the application deadline is June 2nd.
The HERricane Summer Session is a free one-week July program in Brooklyn for
female students interested in emergency management and natural –disaster response
techniques.
The Apex Virtual Mentorship Program for the 2025-2026 school year is accepting
applications(Priority Deadline:May 31st) – Asian-American students from all grades
may apply, especially those from low-income backgrounds.
And all students may apply for a summer internship with the political campaign of
Manhattan City Councilwoman Virginia Maloney – flexible schedules are available.
THEATER/ARTS: The NYC Center in Manhattan welcomes applications from all
students for their free one-week Technical/Design/Administrative Externship,
which introduces participants to behind-the-scenes careers in thetare and
entertainment venues.
And the Open Stage Project’s Act One and Act Two programs teach female and non-
binary students about production & other non-performance theater/entertainment
careers.
STEM: York College in Queens offers a free ‘Aeronautics & Aviation’ six-week
summer program, open to applications from all students.
The Urban Barcode Biology Research at the New York College of Technology in
downtown Brooklyn engages students in studies of biodiversity using DNA
technology. It runs from August to May and is open to applicants from all grades – the
application deadline is May 27th.
For students interested in volunteering in a medical setting, the Margaret Tietz
Nursing & Rehabilitation Center in Jamaica, Queens welcomes volunteers from all
grades – flexible schedules are available.
And the mostly virtual International Young Researchers’ Conference’s Medical
Humanities Program is a low-cost (with financial aid available) opportunity in
partnership with Columbia Medical School. It integrates data, science, and humanistic
aspects of public health care. This is open to all students, and meets for four Sundays
during the summer.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
